seo.title: The Hook | Spiegelworld
seo.description: The Warner Theatre, a revered 1929 Movie Palace, once a pinnacle of cinematic grandeur, lost its entertainment legacy by the 1960s. Enter The Hook, a new entertainment hub paying homage to the Theatre's illustrious past and the vibrant boardwalk it graces.
seo.keywords: Architecture, design, breweries, Birmingham, Monday Night Brewing, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design, The Hook, Spiegelworld, Caeser’s Entertainment, Spiegelworld, R2Architects, Conn Shaffer, Concord Engineering, Corsi Associates, Studio TL, KHSS

projects.title:
THE HOOK
SPIEGELWORLD
projects.partners: Caeser’s Entertainment, Spiegelworld, R2Architects, Conn Shaffer, Concord Engineering, Corsi Associates, Studio TL, KHSS

info.title: Partners
info.descrotion: Caeser’s Entertainment, Spiegelworld, R2Architects, Conn Shaffer, Concord Engineering, Corsi Associates, Studio TL, KHSS

projects.descrition:
The Warner Theatre, a revered 1929 Movie Palace, once a pinnacle of cinematic grandeur, lost its entertainment legacy by the 1960s. Enter The Hook, a new entertainment hub paying homage to the Theatre's illustrious past and the vibrant boardwalk it graces. It cleverly resurrects the Theatre's historic charm, utilizing its façade to evoke 1930s splendor, offering patrons an immersive journey from entry to seat.


Drawing inspiration from the Theatre's history and the boardwalk, The Hook's layout loosely mirrors the historic Theatre. Visitors step through the refurbished façade adorned with a new marquee honoring the original monument. The experience continues with a nostalgic nod to the Steel Pier's diving horse phenomenon through the Horse Dive Bar, featuring a 40-foot atrium showcasing original masonry and stained glass from the bygone Spanish Moorish vestibule.


The journey unfolds further through a reclaimed bowling alley, leading to the black-and-white striped threshold of Tides Out—a theatre bar reminiscent of classical vaudeville, circus acts, and Mark Ogge's renowned circus art. Bursting with vibrant colors, patterns, and dynamic lighting, this space transforms during performances, enveloping patrons in visual spectacle.


Passing through a corridor reflecting 1968's ambiance, patrons encounter the enigmatic purple door of Superfrico—an unconventional restaurant deemed party space accessed through a backstage-like service entry. The restaurant's setting juxtaposes theatre drops and lighting storage against a contemporary mirrored bar adorned with modern art and furnishings. Meanwhile, the main dining area nestled within modified dressing rooms exudes femininity, layered with dramatic artistry.

seo.title: Mercedes Benz Stadium
seo.description: While working with Stanley, Beaman & Sears, Michael served as Project Architect for the General Concourses portions of the Mercedes-Benz Stadium located in Atlanta, Georgia.
seo.keywords: Mercedes Benz, Stadium, Architecture, design, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design, Commercial Architecture

projects.title:
MERCEDES BENZ 
STADIUM
projects.descrition:
While working with Stanley, Beaman & Sears, Michael served as Project Architect for the General Concourses portions of the Mercedes-Benz Stadium located in Atlanta, Georgia. The project was certified LEED Platinum and contains 2 million sq. ft. with a 71,000 seat capacity for football and 32,456 seats for soccer. It is the home of the Atlanta Falcons and Atlanta United and over the years it has won several awards including: 


World Stadium Congress Stadium of the Year

AIA Georgia – Honor Award

AIA Central States Merit Award – Large Commercial

seo.title: Deel Residence
seo.description: Located on a 44 acre remote site along with a 22 acre lake, the Deel Residence is a sanctuary for a couple where they intend to retreat with their extensive family while also providing refuge for those in need. This 9,400 SF building provides a private wing for the family and connects to a more public wing that will serve its guests. These guests will be greeted with sunset views, a calm lake setting and ultimately an atmosphere of healing.
seo.keywords: deel, residence, Architecture, design, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design, Commercial Architecture, Lakeshore, Carrollton, Lake Carroll

seo.description: RAD recently completed a new 14,000 SF Fire Station in Villa Rica, Georgia. This new facility will replace the old station No. 9 and create a state-of-the-art training facility. We are currently in the Construction Administration phase of the project and anticipate the project to be completed by September 2024.

seo.title: Prospector Park
seo.description: Nestled in a largely ignored pocket of downtown Villa Rica exists a park just waiting to be upgraded. RAD has been working with the City of Villa Rica to make this location a destination for adults and kids. Incorporating a long lost “Gold Miner’s” statue along with a grassy knoll, slide, Veterans Memorial space, Villa Rica History Walk and a covered area for food trucks and events, this is a much needed space for our downtown.
seo.keywords: Architecture, design, Villa Rica, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design

seo.title: The Stefanie H. Weill Center for the Performing Arts
seo.description: The Warner Theatre, a revered 1929 Movie Palace, once a pinnacle of cinematic grandeur, lost its entertainment legacy by the 1960s. Enter The Hook, a new entertainment hub paying homage to the Theatre's illustrious past and the vibrant boardwalk it graces.
seo.keywords: Architecture, design, Performing Arts, Theater, Theatre, Sheboygan, Wisconsin, The Weill Center, The Stefanie H. Weill Center for the Performing Arts, Expansion, Historic, Historic Architecture, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design, Uncommon Studios, Pierce Engineers, Ring + DuChateau, Walter P. Moore, SLS Consulting, Miller Engineers & Scientists, Quasius Construction

projects.title: The Stefanie H. Weill Center for the Performing Arts
projects.partners: Uncommon Studios, Pierce Engineers, Ring + DuChateau, Walter P. Moore, SLS Consulting, Miller Engineers & Scientists, Quasius Construction

info.title: Partners
info.descrotion: Uncommon Studios, Pierce Engineers, Ring + DuChateau, Walter P. Moore, SLS Consulting, Miller Engineers & Scientists, Quasius Construction

projects.descrition:
A beloved cultural landmark in the heart of Sheboygan, Wisconsin, the Stefanie H. Weill Center for the Performing Arts has been captivating audiences since 1928. Known for its stunning Spanish Colonial Revival architecture, originally crafted by the Milwaukee Theatre Circuit of the Universal Pictures Corporation, the Weill Center stands as a testament to the golden age of cinema and live performance.

As Sheboygan continues to grow, so too does the need to enhance the Weill Center’s offerings for its loyal patrons and hardworking staff. In response, the Weill Foundation has embarked on an exciting new chapter: a significant expansion to elevate the audience experience and accommodate the evolving needs of the community.

Rickman Architecture + Design (RAD) has been proud to partner with the Weill Foundation since 2022, thoughtfully designing an 18,000-square-foot expansion to the existing 44,500-square-foot facility. This next phase includes a spacious new lobby, vibrant bar areas, a rooftop deck, modernized offices, and essential back-of-house support spaces.

Blending old and new, the design introduces a fresh aesthetic to both the façade and interior while thoughtfully preserving the historic charm and architectural legacy of the original theater.

Construction is set to begin in September 2025, ushering in an exciting new era for one of Sheboygan’s most cherished venues.

seo.description: This project consisted of a pre-engineered metal building that is +/- 8,000 SF (warehouse/w restroom), the second is the offices of FLEXTC constructed out of their flex units and are +/- 8,000 SF, the third building is a fabric structure (+/- 8,000 SF) and includes fabric partitions to separate equipment and contain a wet and dry area.

seo.title: Neva Lomason Memorial Library
seo.description: Libraries are cornerstones of healthy community. More than storage for books, libraries offer educational materials to everyone; they are safe havens for homeless and underserved populations; they offer a variety of programs for community, professional, and personal development; and they preserve local history and steward truth.
seo.keywords: Architecture, design, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design, Commercial Architecture, Neva Lomason Memorial Library

seo.title: Lakeshore Park & Pavilions
seo.description: Lake Carroll in Carrollton, Georgia has always been a strong outdoor amenity to local residents with its boat friendly access and connection to the Carrollton Green Belt. In 2021 the city decided to upgrade this amenity with new outdoor pavilions, a playground for the kids, recreation area and extended walking and biking trails. Phase 1 was completed first and just recently Phase 2 was finished with a complete boardwalk, outdoor event space, expanded boat loading and fishing area.
seo.keywords: Architecture, design, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design, Commercial Architecture, Lakeshore, Carrollton, Lake Carroll

projects.title: Midtown Water Park
projects.descrition: RAD is currently in the Construction Administration Phase for Midtown Water Park.  The scope of work consisted of demolition of existing structures, upgrading and adding to the water park, and construction of a City Park and parking lot adjacent to the water park.

seo.title: City of Refuge
seo.description: City of Refuge Transformation Center is a faith-based organization located in Atlanta, Georgia that helps families and individuals transition out of crisis.
seo.keywords: Architecture, design, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design, Commercial Architecture

projects.title:
CITY OF REFUGE
TRANSFORMATION 
CENTER
projects.partners: City of Refuge, Clark Construction, Third Lens Ministries, Uncommon Studios, SHEAR Structural, Pursuit Engineering, Flippo Civil Design, IMPACT Development Management

info.title: Partners
info.descrotion: City of Refuge, Clark Construction, Third Lens Ministries, Uncommon Studios, SHEAR Structural, Pursuit Engineering, Flippo Civil Design, IMPACT Development Management

projects.descrition: The City of Refuge is a faith-based organization located in Atlanta, Georgia that helps families and individuals transition out of crisis. This one-of-a-kind organization offers health & wellness, housing, job training and youth development in the middle of one of Atlanta’s most historic and struggling neighborhoods where nearly 40% of the residents live below the Federal Poverty Level. In a time of need and fundraising, RAD delivered schematic design and visioning for a new 36,000 SF mixed use facility. Along with these visuals, Bruce Deel was able to raise the funds and the next phase of design & documentation was able to commence. This ground up facility will provide 25 affordable housing apartments, along with a medical clinic, credit union, fresh market and a co-working space which will all aid in the transformation of the lives this organization impacts. There is no better example of a project where architecture can serve as a catalyst for doing good, and we are appreciative and thankful for the City of Refuge allowing up to team with them on this effort. Construction is scheduled to be completed by summer of 2025 and we cant wait to see the lives impacted by this facility.

seo.title: Monday Night Brewing
seo.description: RAD has been fortunate enough to work with one of the best breweries around town on several projects, Monday Night Brewing. Projects include: Pink Dinosaur Pizza fitout at Monday Night Garage, Mobile Pizza Truck, Solar Bar and most recently the Birmingham, Alabama facade upgrade and exterior improvements. Great client, great beer, great pizza, go check out Monday Night Brewing!
seo.keywords: Architecture, design, breweries, Birmingham, Monday Night Brewing, RAD, Rickman Architecture & Design, Atlanta design
